review: Fred was an awesome server! Great customer service! Just visiting here but one of the best TGIFs I've been to.

Came here last night around 10pm. There was a huge party there already and we were sat right next to them. Would've been nice to sit somewhere else but then after a second huge party was seated right next to us. The space was kind of tight.. I mean yeah I get it's easier for the servers but it would've been nice having some space from the other parties.  It did take a couple of minutes for someone to greet us. Once our server came, she was nice but she seemed bored and uninterested. We ordered the endless apps for $10 per person, which is a pretty good deal. However this is my second time ordering this I wish they could switch up the appetizers on the endless apps menu because I'm already getting bored of what's on there. The food came in a timely manner. The food was pretty good. I think my favorite on the menu is the mozzarella sticks. Their marinara sauce is great. Their meatballs are also very good and. I like how it comes with little slices of bread to pair with. I wish we were checked up more often. She did check up on us and we wouldn't be ready to order but she wouldn't come until another 15 minutes when we needed maybe 5 more minutes. Pretty average service. Probably would go to another chain restaurant where the service is more attentive.

For the older woman training the young lady tonight. She basically used me as an example on when to cut people off for drinking too much. Except I only had two drinks! She said there is a time limit for asking for a 3rd drink and I go out to eat at least once a week and Fridays has been my favorite choice. Havent gone to this location much but still! Thanks to the lady using me as a training example and making me feel embarrassed with the other person in my party! Going to keep going to Springfield Fridays just not this one! Always have a good experience there. Dont remember her name but she was the lady dressed in purple with a spider on her face!(For halloween)
Great tasting food, but have to wait a while for the service. Waitstaff continually slow. Only come back because it's affordable and taste good.

I've been here several times and service never lets you down. Whenever we come, it's usually big group and I've never had servers messing up our orders or separate checks.  Foods come out hot and fresh. Most importantly, fast. Environment is clean and not so loud.
Recently visited this location for lunch and dinner.  Service (with Ursula) was great and you can't go wrong with the $10.00 endless apps.

My review is for the bar service only.  I've been to this location several times, both on weekdays and weekends. Weekend evenings are usually pretty busy, but it's manageable (weekend crowd is somewhat obnoxious). Whether we were seating at the hightop tables in the bar area or the bar itself, we were acknowledged promptly with a smile and a menu.  The last 2 times I went there with a friend, our bartender was Brandee. She was nice and friendly, checked on us regularly. My friend had the Blue Hawaiian and I had the Peach Sagria and Double Berry Mojito. The Blue Hawaiian was alright, sangria was too sweet for my taste but the mojito was just on point. Very refreshing - perfect on a sticky summer night. I also had the Jack Daniels chicken breast with sweet potato fries and mac n cheese - and I'm not sure if it's because I was pretty hungry, but it hit the spot! The chicken breast was cooked well, but it wasn't hard and the sweet potato fries were pretty yummy. The mac n cheese was a solid 3.3 :) I can see myself going back, but to the bar only since you can order anything of the regular menu there. I would recommend management keep up with their hostess stand since nobody was to be seen there the whole time I was at the bar.

Francine, the bar tender/waiter was by herself servicing 8 tables spread apart. She was nice and attentive and we appreciated that she tried her best to attend to our needs although we also tried not to ask for too much. She's a hard worker and didn't lose the smile on her face! Oh, and my jack Daniel's ribs were amazing, as always. If I could only get a hold of a bottle of this magic potion.

It has been a while since I last reviewed this TGIF Fridays.  It just seems to be getting worse  and worse.   I like the menu and the prices, but the service, management, and the new renovation is not good.  The waiters consistently made mistakes with the orders.  We ask to have our appetizers served first; yet everything gets served at once.  Twice I have been given a bill for someone else's meal.  I don't like how the bar is open to the dining room.  I miss the old Friday's.   Lively but separate bar; good food; and friendly professional service. Friday's is going to be the next Houlihans or Bennigans.   Tragic.
Horrible staffs that did not even look or talk or serve their clients (August 19 night shift)

After consistent bad service here I was skeptical on coming back. As a last resort we decided to go and our server was fantastic. He explained the specials really well, was really funny, and was very attentive.  I would consider going back again just because he turned my view around a little at this location.
Great HH and that's about it... My server was cool..

This was recent visit past few weeks ago...we were here for happy hour after work and it seems like every1 is about to end their shift...drinks are good but food is getting old for happy hours...its been the same menu for years....wish they would update their menu or something...service again is a hit or miss...
There new long island promo at the bar it's phenomenal! I keep coming back and love the small plates now. Great service!

Food was delicious.  The hostess was pleasant. The booth in which we were seated had had soda spilled on it that was not cleaned up on the bench seat I sat at, so we had to switch booths. Our server seemed nice, but she was so slow and inattentive that our hostess twice had to pitch in to get things done despite our server having only two tables to handle.  There's other Fridays, so no reason to return to this one.
I eat at this location every day food is always great servers and hosts here are the best
I've ate here about 4 times and each time I've gotten sick Weather a burger or steak Always sick

Came here with my coworkers.  It wasn't busy and it was for lunch.  Service was good and the people were nice.  The food was garbage.  One of my lettuce leaves was rotten and the chicken was like rubber.  I think it had to be microwaved - Im not sure and it made me want to vomit when I finished because it had so much garlic.  All I had was a caesar salad.  I probably wont go back.

Fridays... your typical chain restaurant... however its been awhile since I've visited...So long that my stripes rewards expired...So They have revamped their look removing the cheese and upscaling to a modern twist. How did they do... well lets see... I was on a date... we decided to sit at the bar near the TV's. I dono why but the curved seats just seemed awkward to me I mean it did help when watching the TV's but still its just strange.  Anyway...So I opened the menu trying to find the 1/2 off appetizers well  of course  my menu happened to be missing the appetizer page... and lucky for us we asked our waitress about it. She then had to bring me a new menu. Oh and she did mention some of their happy hour specials... however she could've just told us its also listed on their specials menu which also happened to have the beers discounted and the  selection of half off appetizers. Instead she waited until we placed our order  to tell us that unfortunately the ones we choice were not half off only one was. At that rate we just decided that we would order 1 more appetizer to match the 3 for $15 or whatever it was. Appetizers ordered...  the usual spinach  artichoke dip... salty like usual... but it does have the big chunks of artichoke.(oh this was half off lol).   The ahi tuna crisp... basically a fried corn tortilla with a small slice of tuna topped with guacamole... rather prefer it be a plantain chip but hey its Fridays... not a  5 star quality joint. Less then mediocre... Rueben sliders... probably would've tasted good if we didn't wait to eat it last.... however it as just meh... needed an extra side of mustard... and more corned beef. the steak skewers... were kinda chewy... the slaw was good tho. And the pita point was okay. Overall.... its a decent place with variety. Pricey without discounts  but if you go for happy hour its usually pretty worth it. Just remember to order the half price items... oh and if I went earlier for happy hour the fried items might have appealed to me. Friday's might have left the cheese out... but food quality is the same...medicore at best and just a place to eat and drink.
Love the endless apps. Service is spotty sometimes and bathroom could be cleaned more often. But overall good place to eat

Came here with a party of 7. And I would have to say the service was nice! Loved the out server. Her name was Maddie I believe and she kept checking up on us every now and them which was great.  The food was ok. And the drinks we ordered was alright too. The only one thing you gotta worry about is. DONT GET TOO WASTED. Haha had trouble walking to the bathroom because it was too dark in the restaurant.  Not 5 stars because the food is alright. It's not something that you would recommend a friend to eat or try out.

I ordered take-out from here for lunch with a few co-workers. I ordered the  MEDITERRANEAN MAHI MAHI NAAN 'WICHGrilled Mahi Mahi drizzled with balsamic glaze on naan bread with cucumber yogurt sauce,balsamic-glazed onions, garlic, basil & Roma tomato bruschetta and mixed greens with kale. Soooo good! Mahi Mahi was cooked perfectly. Not overcooked at all. Perfect amount of bread. There was some sort of garlic mayo sauce that was really good and added a nice little kick. Would definitely order this again and again. I ordered the fries on the side. Fries were ok, but then again it was take-out. Fries are better when eaten at the restaurant. I did have the option to substitute fries with a salad, which is probably what I will do next time.  I think the low ratings on Yelp is mostly due to service. I've eaten here a few times and each time I've enjoyed my meals. My experience ordering over the phone was good. The lady that helped me got our order correct. Food was ready when promised.
Went for lunch today. My son and I sat at the bar .... well, a booth. Great service and the appetizer special was awesome. A clean restaurant and personable staff.

Unfortunately, yet another bad experience has solidified our decision to never return to this restaurant. The waitress was good. Manager was terrible.  The only alcoholic drink we ordered was 99% ice. It took two slurps from the straw to clear it. It was $8.50 I ordered a steak cooked medium and it came out rare and bloody (picture below). My fries were cold. Our drinks were not once refilled.  Manager just stood there with excuses instead of listening to the issues.  Will not be back.

Came in around midnight cause I had the munchies- ordered the steak (medium) with lobster topping with a side of fries & mac n cheese. Everything was great till I cut the steak. It was VERY well done and dry. The lobster topping was bomb though. I didn't send it back since it was pretty late. Ate my sides, paid my check and left. Never going to Friday's for a steak again...

I was surprised to see the rating for this location. That is the only reason moving me to leave a review this time. All I have to say is that if my family feels like TGIF, we drive from Annandale to this location  just because we like the service and the consistency on the food over other locations.
I tried spicy shrimp roll for the first time at this place and it was amazing. I like the environment and the service was good.

My wife and my mother ordered French Dip sandwiches.  They were very disappointed with the sandwiches - too much fat in meat.  Ended up only ate half sandwich after cutting the fat off. The French fries were so-so.  Should have gone to Main Street Pub in Clifton or Kilroy's in Springfield.

Wow, never thought I would give a place 1-star...but hey here it goes!  I came here with my family yesterday night, so a Tuesday. First of all, it took them forever to acknowledge us when we walked through the door; there was no host/hostess to help us whatsoever and literally no one even tried to come up and seat us...there was a LINE behind us! But hey, waiters and waitresses completely ignored us.  When we finally got seated, our waiter (who I shall not name) took forever to take our orders. We had to repeat our orders SEVERAL times because for some odd reason he couldn't hear us. Our food came out, but it all came out quite slowly. He came out empty-handed and tells us "I swear I just had your salad in my hand!" and RUNS BACK IN TO GET MY SALAD...HOW DO YOU NOT KNOW YOU DON'T HAVE MY ORDER IN YOUR HAND? When he wasn't bringing out our food, he was mingling in the kitchen...how about you use your time to clean the 4+ tables around us that are dirty as heck? He barely came to check up on our table...maybe once and that's it. If you're wondering about the food, it was awful. Everything was very dry and didn't taste fresh at all...I got the cobb salad with grilled chicken and it was so bland.  So, check time. We try to look for our waiter so that he can bring us our check...guess what, he's nowhere to be found! Obviously, the manager (I'm assuming) noticed that we were struggling so she walked over and gave us the check herself. We try to look for our waiter again to give the check to so that we can just pay and leave, but again he's nowhere to be found. I had to walk up to ANOTHER waiter and hand her the check and she seemed so frustrated at our waiter. She had that kind of voice that just seems like she's used to our waiter's working habit...she said "Wow of course...WHERE'S _____?" to the other waiters, yet none of them knew where he was! She apologized to me and told me that it's not right for me to have to do this and give my check to another waiter and got very mad at our waiter. He FINALLY came out as we were leaving and apologized because he had to take an "important phone call". Overall, it was a nightmare. Never going here ever again...would rather drive all the way down to Tyson's and eat at the TGIF there!

I've had two rather horrible experiences at this Friday's: The first time I tried to eat there, we waited 15 minutes in the front for someone to seat us. The hostess came over and talked to the people in front of us, without even acknowledging that we were standing behind them, left and did not return. There was a line behind us and while people were waiting, most left to dine elsewhere. There were plenty of tables available and more than enough wait staff standing around. The waiters nearby just stared at us and did not help. When we finally asked a passing waiter if they could assist with seating us, he said to wait for the hostess. We left and went to the California Tortilla behind it - that place wasn't great either, but at least they served us (and a few people who were in line behind us at the Fridays)! The second time, My friend and I were actually able to get seated in the bar area.  It was very busy, and I would normally take that into consideration, but they had a lot of people standing around and so I will not let that excuse the bad service.  The only times that my waiter came to the table was to take the drink order, bring the drinks and take our order, a diff waiter/food runner brought our food, and then the waiter brought the check about 10 minutes after my friend and I both finished our meals.  We did not get checked up on at all during our meal by anyone and did not even get an offer of a drink refill. I will not go back to this Friday's, but will not rule out going to different locations.

great time dining here! Usually I don't expect much from TGI Friday's but this time our experience was great. We sat in the bar area, it was around 7 so a pretty busy dinner rush and were greeted immediately. Our server Jordan was awesome! Constantly checked up on us for our endless apps, made great suggestions, and was always there for prompt drink refills. They're drink specials are great and can't go wrong with endless apps!

Wow...what a change indeed. This experience has totally put us off of Friday's; my friend and I were lured in by a commercial and living so close we decided this was the only logical place to eat..mistake. Firstly, we sit at the bar which is fairly empty for 7pm on a Thursday, obviously the happy hour crew found somewhere better to be. We're greeted right away- not with a smile or anything just "hi, my name is...what can I get you" .. no explanation of the appetizer deal, no specials (does Friday's do specials?). I end up order just 2 beers and my friend orders the Jack chicken strips- smothered in sauce their not difficult to make good and that it not where the problem came in for us. I ordered a cup of dirt..yes, the children's dessert with chocolate pudding, gummy worms, and crumbled oreos on top- 15 minutes after ordering it and it still not arriving, our bartender comes over and says it'll be right out and I say actually since it's been a while we're ready for our checks; she huffs about it and storms back to the kitchen to tell them to cancel the dessert- maybe had she put it in when it was ordered I wouldn't have cancelled it.  Anyways, we get out bill- singular- even though we said checkS..not a blink of her asking if we'd like it separated, luckily my friend covered for me because I only had my card and we decided if we tried to ask for it to be split a certain way it would've turned out wrong. After we sign the check..guess what shows up?! My cup of dirt...20+ minutes after I ordered..the male bartender asked who ordered it and I said oh I ordered that 20 minutes ago and cancelled it 10 minutes ago..instead of saying "oh no I'm sorry for the wait, here you go anyways" or anything productive.. he passes it off to a buss boy and says "this is dead now" in the most condescending tone- see ya, jerk. Last but not least..THE ANTS. Everywhere, all over the bar; we hadn't noticed because the plate was covering them but once the chicken dish was gone they were crawling all over. GROSS. I would say I'm sorry I won't be returning because this used to be my favorite after work place to hang but I know sorry wouldn't get me anywhere with the rude staff. See ya never.

We had just a HORRIBLE experience with this location the other night! A group of 9 of us came in to hang out and use the endless appetizers promotion that they are doing. All of us ordered an appetizer so we could share all 9 of them at the tables. Everyone had either alcohol or another drink - so we were giving them a fair amount of money. This isn't like a group coming in and trying to split one. We had to ask repeatedly to get some plates and silverware, because only 2 people had silverware at the table. The servers were nonexistent and after bringing a new round of the appetizers just stopped answering us or coming to our table. We had people wanting to buy more drinks and just couldn't get service. It was horrible, and I would't recommend it. There are other great places in town to hang out socially.

I used to love this place but now it's not even on the list of places I want to eat at.  I ordered a salad and the bruschetta chicken pasta.  My salad didn't taste fresh, I actually had to spit out one of the tomatoes because it tasted like it was molding, and my entree was mediocre/bland.  The deal they have going on currently  didn't really seem like a deal to me because my husband and I weren't allowed to share an unlimited appetizer, it's literally one per person and who eats an appetizer alone?  The rewards of the stripes program are not anything special, not to mention my accumulated points were voided simply because I hadn't eaten there in awhile.  I won't be eating here in the foreseeable future.

Not the day to visit this location?  We sat for 20mins WITHOUT the salsa/chips!  Which for a Stripes patron (who clearly displayed my card). Is ridiculous!  The salsa/chips showed up about 15mins before our entrees!  Our table server, Jasmin, was okay?  Not sure she wanted to be at work? Question:  Ever have a Friday coupon code and YOU'RE asked to write it down for the table server!!  The food was decent; BUT, clearly overshadowed by the poor customer service.  I gotta find another location...sooooooo disappointed.

I like TGIF but after today, I am never coming back even if they give me a free meal. As soon as we got there, it took longer than usual for the hostess to attend us, mind me there was not a single soul in there!!We sat next to another family that was waiting for their food. I ordered the Jack Daniels ribs w/ broccoli & mashed potatoes. My husband got a burger with fries. It took like 10 minutes for our food to be served. My ribs were ok, but the broccoli was stale and it had black spots all over it. My husband had to ask the waiter to take his burger back because it was raw. Meanwhile, the family next to me were talking to the manager complaining about the food and the service. Bottom line is, I have never had an issue with TGIF but today it was just horrible, we payed to eat trash and we might as well would have gone to eat McDonald's...
Well now I'm receiving messages from the staff about my previous review. Kudos TGI of Fair Lakes, you hired one hell of a team!

I'm a regular at TGIF, usually come two or three times a month or even more on occasion, since it's one of the restaurant that opens till 2am when I get off work around 10pm. I always get the chicken wings as starter, always delicious even though there was one time when it tasted like crap. But mistakes happens. Ribs are a must try, always get that and the pasta as well. Service was always excellent, but waiting for the food to be cook is very long. Not to mention their dessert, it's yummy and how it melts in your mouth is like a stairway to heaven. Love this place, will be coming often.

Rather disappointed with the service I received at this particular location. A friend and I went out for a late dinner and waited by the front to be seated. There was no one at the front, except for a young man sitting on his phone on the bench. We assumed he was als waiting. We were surprised when he got up and asked if we would like to be seated. Really?? How unprofessional. As if the experience couldn't be any worse, we were seated with a waitress who loudly announced "please not my section". The host ignored her request and sat us in her section anyway. Dinner was very rushed and our server clearly did not want to be there. Our food was brought out with no utensils,and our waitress was irritated when we asked for it. Will only be coming back to frequent the bar.

Food was good but service was extremely slow. Waited about fifteen minutes before even meeting our waitress. Food took a very long time to arrive once we ordered and it was inaccurate. (They fully cooked medium-rare burger and added the pickles I requested to not have.) I didn't bother mentioning it but for a very quiet and non-busy afternoon they didn't do well.

Ordered a quick midnight snack that ended up taking most of my night. I got the jack Daniels burger with no bacon but unfortunately there was some confusion and now I'm stuck waiting for another one. I'm Fine with waiting i just wish they would have gotten it right the first time. Definitely disappointed. The atmosphere is pretty casual although it is a bar crowd mostly watching sports. Not a place id like to hang out in my free time.
The full rack bbq ribs were a bit salty and very dry for my taste. The bbq sauce was very good though! The service was good as well.

Let me start out by saying that I agree with the other negative reviews about the service being absolutely horrible.  We had three different servers during our lunch and none of them knew which way was up.  When the bill came, our entrees and drinks were broken apart, but in a mish-mash that was such a cluster that we just asked the server to just split it down the middle.  Completely useless. Now that I've gotten that out of the way....  I want to take a bath in the Jack Daniel's Glaze.  I dipped practically every morsel of food into that glorious sauce.  Half rack of overly dry ribs?  Miracles happened when I dipped the dry little bites into that sauce.  Underwhelming french fries became little potato vehicles to shove more of that glaze into my face.  Nubby little excuses for chicken tenders?  Splash them through some sauce and they sing to me in chorus! TGIF - bottle the glaze.  Get rid of everything else.

First called 20 mins before coming in no answer came in to order my food for take out manager told me to just go to the bar and order i went to the bar waited 5 mins to get order taken then the bald guy that took my order at the bar told me to hirry up and make the order can understand its busy but im also a manager of auto body shop and i know that is not how you treat a customer manager told me he answered the phone but i called three times and it rang and rang horrible custoner service

After walking in on a semi empty bar, I proceed to have a seat, as two bartenders and the GM (haidar) which I find very hard to grasp of how she's even a manager, let alone the GM. As I'm waiting to be acknowledged, as it's quite difficult not to spot a new customer sitting down, I go on to be completely ignored by all 3. So, as I'm sitting down coming up with excuses of why they wouldn't even greet me (I mean, even IF they were busy, a smile, and an "I'll be right with you" would've been appreciated) I am a regular at Fridays, but this is my first time here, I usually go to the one in Tysons, and this is how I know what the GM's name is, as she used to work there, and she wasn't any good then, so I'm not surprised of the unpleasant encounter. I grab a menu, to waste time, and to ensure that they saw me (I practically know everything on the menu by heart) but nope, no recognition is ANY sort. After 15 minutes I ask to see a manager, she comes around with her Northface jacket, and a hoodie on her head (extremely unprofessional) and as I was mentioning to her of the situation (certainly not complaining) but merely letting her know that they need to step it up. Her response was nothing short of incompetent and what I had expected of her from the what I have heard (never believed any of them, because I've never had an issue at the Tysons location) with her uneducated and unprofessional response, I ask to see the GM, when she affirms her role as the GM with a smirk (it does not get worse than this) implying that she is the boss, and if I had any further complaints that I should let corporate know, she then cuts the conversation and says that I am out of time as she is scheduled to clock out, and if I needed to still have this addresses, that she will have her "other" manager listen to me. UNREAL! Being a person that is in retail, customer service, and had started off in the restaurant business; she has failed in EVERY aspect to meet my expectation as a consumer-as if I am worthless, even though customers are the ones that make or break a business, and now I fully understand why everyone gave such shitty reviews about this particular location. NO EMPLOYEE should ever disregard and belittle a customer in the matter I was treated, let alone a GENERAL MANAGER. With everything that has transpired, I will assure you that I will never step foot in this location EVER again due to the mistreatment, condescending, and sarcastic mannerisms this person chooses to carry herself with.

Usually i have a great time here. Came here on a sunday (12/7) night for food and drinks.((Edit: BTW! The restaurant was 70% EMPTY and our server had us and JUST ONE OTHER TABLE, 2 TABLES)) It was initially a table of four; we got seated in a booth. The first beer took 20 mins without seeing our server (Cody? I forget), idk he mustve been hiding. We had another friend join so they moved us to a larger table where no server was covering, long story short...drink orders took 15-20 minutes EACH!, our food was dropped my our wonderful server, so after almost an HOUR of waiting(for 3 freakin burgers), they had to refire up the kitchen to remake our order. What a painful dinner night. I'm not sure if ill order from the same server again.  PS: servers should apologize (not disappear again out of humiliation) if they cant hold 3 burger plates and esp! If you drop it in front of hungry customers PPS: the food taste and quality was SO subpar yet, if i asked for it to be fixed, i was afraid to be hungry for another hour... PPPS: to our server(wherever u are)...please bring appetizers to the table ur suppose to bring it to when their ready...no one wants cold appetizers with undercooked, oily, rushed burgers Just so baffled, smh. Honestly been a long time since i felt the need to make a low rating.

So disappointed. Came in on a Thursday with a friend for a quick after work drink. Took forever to be acknowledged by our server first and foremost. Ordered from the "Happy Ever Hour" menu, and let's just say I was far from happy. Our drinks were watered down and poorly made. When we voiced our complaint to management he rudely went on the defense. After hearing our complaints he replaced our Absolut mixed drinks with "bottom shelf" drinks. Let's not talk about the food, the Turkey Kale Soup looked and tastes DAYS OLD! Never going back!

ordered the Jack Daniels burger and it was alright it was a little burnt on the edges but the waiter was super nice. I always usually order the Jack Daniels flat iron steak which is really good I think I'll stick to that from now on I only come here once of twice a year. My husband ordered a burger here too and it was crispy as well.  We had a gift card so ehh no biggie.

As usual this place is not that great. The food was sloppy and the service was slow. I'm glad we got basic meals. Melvin was nice but slow. When the bill came, he also didn't ask my friend if he would like change back. Instead he took everything. Unprofessional. I've been in the food industry and never had this tolerated.  Other than that, nothing special.  The bar is not as great. The best TGIFriday's I've enjoyed for sit down is Tysons Corner and Springfield.  As for bar service, Alexandria and Tysons Corner.

A little disappointed... actually maybe a bit more than a little. I hadn't been to a TGIF in quite a few months so I was anxious to check out the new "less cheese" I heard advertised on the radio. Well the cheese is gone but the staff at this particular restaurant needs a lot more training. When we first walk-in there is no hostess waiting at the front as I use to remember and no one came while we looked back and forth unsure of how to proceed.  We gave a shrug and decided to just head for the bar, usually better service anyways.... or so I thought. Sat down at one of the bar booths and the waitress is dull and not engaging at all. She tells us the specials and we order drinks and then some food. The drinks were rather quick but the waitress disappeared.... we finished our drinks and she still hadn't checked up on us, so we kept kind of looking around the small bar and she was no where to be seen. Luckily there was another waitress working some of the other tables and she brought us some waters. When our waitress finally shows up again its with our food and its barely lukewarm! Disappointment all around cause I love the fries here! UGH! We could tell she had let it sit and we were an after thought. She then promptly disappeared again (all the while we are watching the other red-headed waitress bustling around the bar) and we have to practically run her down to ask for a check to leave.  All I can say is, that as of right now I can't believe we got such bad service... I am use to experiencing better... bad service, just plain bad service.

Im not typically a fan of Fridays but I came here one night and was swept away. The service at this location is awesome, or waiter made sure my drink was full every time (robert) i think his name. He let us know about the specials both drinks and food. The AYCE appetizers is great we went with the waiters recommendations and were completely satisfied. I will def revisit this location. Thanks for putting the Fun back in Fridays restaurants.

Good place for happy hours and bar food. The only thing I can complain about is that the food is always a bit too salty. I don't know if that's just me, but it's something that I've noticed. They have great daily drink specials and happy hour appetizers. I would recommend the Grey Goose Cooler for the girls, which includes my favorite liqueur, St-Germain. It's so sweet and refreshing! Definitely something to try at least once. The service can be a little spotty. I've had some great servers at this location and some, not so much.

Came in late this afternoon for a quick bite after some shopping and had a very pleasant experience. Our waitress was phenomenal and attentive. We decided on beers and split two big appetizers. Drinks and food arrived promptly, the nachos and pretzels were hot and tasty.  Will definitely be back again!

Normally I wouldn't review a chain restaurant, b/c I think everyone has been to that chain at least once in their lives.  I am only posting a review b/c on my most recent visit, there was food stuck on the INSIDE of my beer glass (see photo).  That was a big piece and not just something that can be overlooked unless you aren't really cleaning the glasses.  It was disgusting and ruined an otherwise decent meal.   So be warned:  The dishes are dirty.  That means food is dirty, staff is dirty, ahhhhh!!!
Terrible service sat at our table for 15-20 minutes before our server came. Everyone acted like they were slammed but there were tons of tables opened. Won't be returning to this location

This place is okay food wise.. I just hated the strong liquor smell when you enter the place and how people are somewhat in a hurry or not patient on you ordering. But again, food wise.. it's pretty good.

An hour into the wait for our food to show up, my coworker sighed and said "This is beginning to feel like "Mondays". I just want it to be over." Not that it was super unpleasant, the restaurant is fine, comfortable, staff super friendly.  It was that we had to wait forever for our food during "lunch rush" in a restaurant that was not even half full.  Our server refilled our drinks 1 at a time.  When our food finally did come out, two of the orders were undercooked.  One was missing one of the sides. When my coworker asked about the other side, he was told "oh yeah, we're out of that". Anyways, food was good, service was not what I would expect from a not busy restaurant during lunch time.

Went there with my sister, tried their wings. And they were really good. My sister liked them a lot. They tasted fresh and most importantly, they tasted like real chicken! Our server was cool too! Overall had a good time over there! :)

Obviously the food from Fridays to Fridays doesn't change too much but in my opinion this is the best location in the Fairfax/Loudoun county area. Great bar team, awesome wait staff, and a decent selection of bar food/coctails. The Jack Daniels menu is always killer, and the unlimited appetizers for 10$ is a hell of a deal while it lasts. Jump in and get some unlimited wings for the upcoming NFL season.

I stopped in to grab a bite to eat and watch some of the NFL games.  The food was good and they had every game on at least channel on the televisions.  The only complaint that I had was that the drink service was kind of slow.  The bar and restaurant weren't really busy.

They don't know the menu. They ran out of October Fest beer and it's only October 5th. We had to ask for napkins and appetizer plates. Ridiculous service and these are the green beans they are serving now. Crumbs ....... Crumbs ....... Crumbs.

Decent place in the neighborhood to come with your family and friends. I've been here a few times already. Note that not every location is the same. I avoid there herndon location like the plague. Went there once, got seared and was ignored for 10' even with us asking the host and other server for attention. Walked out of there fast and ran to this location and was so pleased.  Went there again for happy hours and was pleased with the food and service. We got the $5 Blood Orange and it was delicious. Our server was nice and charming but we felt like he kinda rushed us out of the table, guess we should have sat at the bar. But overall, it was great as always.

... Ehhhhh I don't even know where to start. I  sat at the bar... Took me literally about 15 minutes to get the bartenders attention from gossiping with his coworker. At this time it was absolutely dead. I ordered a grey goose dirty martini... Not only did he pour rail, ( ok whatever, he possibly forgot i wanted grey goose) I didn't want to complain because maybe he was having a off day. After I finished that they got a good amount of people for happy hour. I ordered hot wings, and a corona... I finished the corona, food still wasn't out. I decided to order another Martini, making sure I clearly said grey goose. Nope he poured rail again... But on top of that he stuck his hand in the olive jar, shook my Martini, sneezed directly into it at the service bar... And still gave it to me! Gross. I was infuriated. I will never return. I asked for my check he charged me only for 1 rail vodka... Im assuming he forgot to ring in my wings because I never told him to cancel my check. I simply just asked for it. He was forgetful, looked dirty, and sneezed in my damn drink. Never again. Yuck.

2 words- SH*T HOLE. It's my fault for stepping foot back in here because my little sister wanted to come but I should have said no. Whoever the manager is, NEEDS to go to McDonalds cleaning the floors, they must not give a flying wooha about their employees. They must have did a blind test and said whoever counts to 3 can get the job. Employees do not get trained whatsoever and you can tell. Let me tell you what happened on this ungrateful Tuesday (11/5/13) at 4pm.  I called this location around 3:45 to ask what happy hour specials they had and the lady said, "We have half off appetizers at the bar". I thought great saving me some money. So my sister and I get here at 4pm and walk straight to the bar area. Our bartender acknowledged us because we definitely made eye contact and there were about 10 people there so its not like he couldn't see us. We didn't even see the hostess until 5 minutes later so if we wanted to sit in the dining rooms we would have waited. So we sit there and hes giving people drinks whatever and 5 minutes pass by. I'm thinking you can't even come to get our drinks? I see the hostess and ask, "Are the half price apps  only in the bar area?" She said no they apply to the whole restaurant. I told great because the bartender is taking a very long time.  She sits us down in the dining room and theres about 2 other tables in the whole place thats being served to. She said sorry for the wait and I asked which apps are excluded from the half off appetizers? She said, I'm not sure but they should be $3 each ask your waiter. I said sure. I thought finally some damn service. Nope, waiters walk by and we don't get service for another 3-4 minutes. Some tall caucasian guy who looks homeless because he started no shave november a couple months ago comes to our table. So I asked him what apps are excluded? He tells me that's not our special tonight its the Jack Daniel's specials, and "oh...but the bar has half price apps". I told him I just freakin moved from there and the host told me its half price everywhere. He tells me with a f*kin smirk on his face and a shrug "I'm sorry?!?!?!...but let me get your drinks" I said no I'm leaving. What a douche. I look at the host as I'm leaving and she says "you want to sit at the bar now?" No bitch I don't want anything to do with you. Who hired her?!?! At least carry a damn cheat sheet if you don't know your stuff. So you're telling me I just wasted 15 minutes of my life sitting with a menu in front of me?! Goodness gracious. They act like its a crowded restaurant. I hope they get no customers and are forced to shut down.  I really would love for new management to take over at this location. I mean you can't expect the best service here but at least pretend to like people. I can't even tell you how bad I hate this place. It's a great place for people to kill time and have a drink. But for food and service you can just forget about it. I give this place negative stars. Actually they don't even deserve stars, they deserve the scum under my shoes. Not even my shoes, the rat's dirty ass feet that's in TGI Fridays Fairfax's kitchen. Get your shit together.
Went here for dinner and ordered the Memphis dry rub ribs and they were really good. They need to add the ribs to the kids menu....

Please allow me to tell you about my experience last night. I arrived last night and sat down in the bar area, the whole time a man who clearly had been over served was free styling at the top of his lungs screaming profanity and vulgar sexual acts in detail that no one, especially a lady should hear. The bartender Mike who immediately gave off the attitude of not wanting to be there stopped by after 5-10 minutes to get my drink order. To try and lighten the mood I asked him "hey what's the deal with that guy screaming made up songs about killing and raping people over there, is he drunk or something?" Mikes response was with a condescending attitude "I don't know, why don't you ask him yourself" no idea where managment was during this whole ordeal. I was waiting for my girlfriend at the time and if she arrived and he hadn't stopped yelling about how he was gonna "kill you in your kitchen?" I was going to ask him to stop myself. Instead of the staff of the building keeping the peace it would have been left up to me I guess. I didn't know that apparently I work at a TGI Friday's... and Tuesday nights are trap house nights at Friday's. Luckily Flavor Flav's doppleganger settled down and stopped screaming by the time my old lady showed up. But luckily our meal came with a show when I was then treated to the sight of him making clearly unwanted advances on any girl within arms reach. My fingers were crossed that he would stop by my table so I could try and instigate a fight with this little drunk man. My plan was cause as much property damage as possible during the scuffle to hopefully teach the staff a lesson about not letting customers disrespect your house, and the dining experience of others. My boneless wings were tasty and savory, as was my girlfriends salmon.

The worst!!!! RUN AWAY!  We stopped by on a Friday night around 9:00p for a family dinner.  After waiting for 30 min for a waiter to take our drink orders.. We were already starving! The place looked fully staffed yet the restaurant was pretty empty.  Most of the staff were sitting in the food prep area chit chatting ignoring the other tables as well.  When we got up to ask for carry out instead after waiting over an hour for our food, we were ignored.  After asking the manager to prepare our food to go.. We had to wait another 30 min because they forgot our sides.  He also looked at us as if we were inconveniencing him.  Needless to say we left no tip for the waitress who dropped our drinks off and never came back.  The same night our bank card was charged $250.00 to some random store... Coincidence??? Maybe but I'm not convinced.  Worst dining experience ever!!

I would give minus 1 star if that was possible, horrible service. We came here at 7 for paint night and let the server know that we will dine in after the class. Which took her about 25-30 mins to come to our table. Having brought a drink out without a straw, so we waited 10 mins for that. We places our order and specifically asked for no meat, of any kind in our nachos, we received our nachos at 10:10p.m. on Wed evening, with sausage on it. Returned and reordered it at 10:21 and asked for it to go. We waited till 10:45, just to drive all the way back to Ashburn just to know that it had sausage on it. It was 11:10 when I got home and couldn't have dinner. The manager couldn't even return our money, (cause the money was taken before the order came out, and no change was brought back). He said that "cash", that I paid, "the drawer was sealed". How can the drawer be sealed when cash was paid, when the bar and restaurant is open? Patrick being the Indian manager, should learn his customer service skills and understand if they don't eat beef, perhaps, others can be vegans, or allergic to certain meats/foods. Never again will we ever done there again. Poor customer service and lack of skills on management part.

Lunch on Tuesday 1:00 p m. Place is empty, which I can't figure out. The food is good, service is excellent, dining area and bar are clean and attractive. So is the rest room. Two of us ordered the soft pretzel and cheese dip for starter. My companion liked it; I did not. I think the bacon topping lent it the flavor of pork fat. Did not appeal to me. Maybe you CAN have too much bacon. Anyway our waiter had the manager visit to make sure we were happy. I figured the problem is just my personal taste. Mains were hamburgers and fries which were seasoned right and cooked as ordered. Tasted good. As did the fries. We could not resist the warm brownie and ice cream dessert. Altogether a very nice meal.  I would recommend a visit.

Typical chain. We've come to this location fairly consistently for a few years. Overall more good experiences than bad. There are only 2 times that I can truly recall having a bad experience which was then exacerbated by the server being either non-responsive to the massively undercooked meat (blue) or in the other case lying about the remedy for the order she put in wrong. Both times when we eventually spoke to the manager they were very helpful and apologetic. Usually though our servers and service are good, slower when the restaurant is super busy obviously. But as far as chain restaurants go, I keep coming back to this location because they treat their customers well.

Friday's is good during happy hour but other than that I would not pay full price for their beers or food.  The food is always decent and I can't complain about service.   They are also very good about putting on whatever game you want to watch and I usually only come when I am blacked out on my NHL Gamecenter package.   I would agree that this location is cleaner and nicer than most TGI Friday's but in the end the still serve the same old food as all the other locations.

Food took a little while. Coffee refill never came. Alfredo pasta was dry, my burger was a mess, patato skins were over cooked and the atmosphere has changed. Not how it use to be. I'd rather spend my money elsewhere.

If you wanted to give the restaurant industry an enema- you would put the pipe here. To say the food was terrible would be an understatement. Between cold frozen vegetables on our plate and the bland, undercooked beef I can't decide which was worse. Even the water was bad. Take this failure and mix it up with the lousy service, snarky attitude of the waiter and the slow service and you have the first one star review I have given.

I came here on a Saturday night with my girlfriend.  We were seated fairly quickly and the restaurant was about 90% full. We were seated about 7:50 pm. Our waiter didn't greet us until about 8:00 pm. He asked us for our drink order and at the same time we ordered our food since we knew what we wanted.   We observed 3 more parties coming in after 8 pm.  They all had a different waitress. Their waitress greeted them within 2 minutes. They also received their drinks within 2 minutes. By this time it was 8:20 pm and we still had not received our drinks. So we decided to leave.  Upon leaving we told the person upfront who had a red shirt and black tie on what happened and were leaving.  That person just said ok and did not even bother to retain us or apologize.
Crish and Jimmy are the best bartenders there hands down. Always making sure their customers have their full attention and great customer service. Will be returning

Came here around 530 with some friends on Friday afternoon for some drinks and appetizers. Great place for happy hour, lasts from 4-9pm. Pretty much happy hour deals everyday which is nice. Food isn't bad, but I probably would not come here for a meal. I definitely prefer drinking and eating appetizers at HH to having dinner at this chain restaurant:/

We were a walk in group of about 12, and more people joined our group throughout the night, so basically a servers nightmare since we didn't call ahead and were all separate checks. However, our server Par was super friendly, on point, and incredibly patient with our group. We were celebrating a monumentous week, so you can imagine we wanted to drink. She did her best. I wish she would have gotten more help from the bar... A few of us didn't want to overwhelm her so we went to the bar and the bartender gave us a look, told us to ask our waitress for drinks, and continued to lean against the bar and do absolutely nothing. Meanwhile our server was hustling around.... I'd say the establishment lost a good 100$ at least in alcohol sales simply because we didn't want to stress her out anymore and drinks were taking too long. Thank you Par!

I come here a few times a year for happy hour with friends. Service is slow, staff is okay, I don't think I've ever come here and was greeted or waited on with a smile. But the specials are great and cheap. I don't really have any complain about food either.

Recently I've met some pretty awesome bartenders there. Moe has always been a favorite of mine. The food is eh. Luckily, I've only dealt with one rude waitress who made it seem like she was doing you favors instead of doing her job, but other than her, everyone else is really awesome and they have good drink specials.

I haven't been here in over a year and I finally remember why!  The food has always been sub-par to me, however, on this last visit, I'm sad to report that it has gone even further downhill.  Despite having a decent selection of food, I still found difficulty picking something to eat, as most of the entrees were all reminiscent of one another.  I went with the hibachi chicken skewers .... it could've been good but it was just way too salty for me.  I'm a strong believer that food shouldn't be slathered in sauce in order to taste good.   I'm a fan of the happy hour, which goes till 9pm now (woot woot!) and their appetizers.  I haven't had an appetizer there that I wouldn't order again.  The service was also kind of slow that night, although our waitress was super nice and sweet (sorry! .. this isn't a reflection on you!) My suggestion, pass on the entrees, go there for the apps and happy hour prices.  (they also offer 1/2 of selected appetizers from 3-9pm :)

If you want to wait for your cold food for over an hour, then this place if for you!  Used to love going here... but the quality of the food and the time to wait for your food has become an on going issue. It's sad, but won't be going there again.
Great service behind the bar  ! Very attentive and courteous staff. Although they need to carry better brands and more varieties.
Came here to get dessert and the service was super slow. Took him 15 mins to get us an order of fries. When asked if they  had tea they  only had black tea.

This place sucks!! Cheap food, was cold and half-ass!! Was trying to barely enjoy my nasty meal and the overly confident bartender tried to do some fancy bottle-flipping move and dropped and broke the bottle, scared the sh#t outta me!! It was overall a dull place to eat, and I still tipped good... BUMMER!

Came here tonight after seeing an advertisement for $10 endless appetizers and $3 happy hour specials. The drinks were bland and too sour. Our waiter misled us to believe that the "10 dollar endless appetizers" included any of the listed appetizers. Upon ordering multiple appetizers, we received our bill which included each appetizer charged separately. We explained the misunderstanding to our waiter, however, there was no wiggle room with the prices. Yes , we paid 10 dollars for disgusting potato skins that we thought were free.  Overall, bad food and below average drinks. As a customer, I felt taken advantage of and disrespected. Will not be returning here ever again.
Service is always so slow here. Our appetizers came AFTER our food and was cold. Their soups were too salty couldn't even eat it.  Oh and our drinks cam e out after the food also.

I'm flabbergasted! I actually get excited when I get an email from Fridays telling me about $3 drinks and 1/2 price apps, however, when I came in I was informed it was only available in the bar area (ps the bar area was packed! Not a single spot open!) and they could not honor the email in the dining area. The email said "dine-in only", nothing about the bar area. The manager said there was nothing he could do...great customer service...

I came here late at night for a "midnight snack" Biggest mistake of my life! I felt sick afterwards, it could of been the bottle of wine I had previous or it could of been the food, who knows?? My sister ordered the value meal which was 3 items for 12.99 We ordered the spinach artichoke flat bread-don't order this! It's dry and not good at all The burger was okay. However the vanilla bean cheesecake was good so it made up for everything else. We also ordered a basket of fries, it was too salty and barely any fries. (I miss The Hat-Californians know what I'm talking about)
Service in the bar was disappointing. We had empty beer and water glasses for at least 20 minutes, so we cashed out and went elsewhere.

Used GrubHub to order.  I will never do this again.  I'll just order from somewhere that delivers themselves or just go to the resteraunt myself.  Original estimate time was 30 minutes on GrubHub's site.  Got the confirmation email from GrubHub, and was upped to almost 2 hours.  I should have just cancelled.  But, I figured it was a Friday night, so things are busy.  Even with upping the delivery, they were still late.  Food was completely cold, fries were soggy, desserts (which were bagged with the hot food) were melted and warm.  We were able to freeze them and ate them the next day, but still a disappointment. If you want something delivered, go with the usual pizza or Chinese or something that has their own delivery service.  If you want a sit-down like TGIF or something, just go to the place, sit down, and have a good meal.  It will be quicker, hot, and cheaper (the $11 delivery charge plus tip made the meal almost $60, would have been closer to $40 at the actual place).

I've been going here for the past 9 years. The service in this place has gone downhill overall. I recently went there with my boyfriend because we wanted good food at 10pm. This was during the ESPY Awards because I was watching Caitlyn Jenner's speech on silent while waiting for my waitress.  We stand around for about 5 mins to be seated, no one comes to say hi but they just keep looking at us and passing. Uh...okay. Way to make me feel welcomed! We wanted to sit at the booth, not in the bar area. So we are like, ok, whatever, let's sit at the bar area. We waited another 10 minutes for our waitress to come to our table and greet us. She brings us menus and we ask for a couple of minutes to think. We are ready to order...our waiter is standing by her little stand just braiding her hair and texting. We waive...no...she decided she was mentally checked out of her job. Finally, about 15 minutes later, she comes to get our order. Never visits us again until the food arrives 25 mins later (we ordered 1 appetizer and a beer). We wait another 20 minutes...our waitress is still just chilling. She clearly wasn't busy because she was literally just walking around, wiping some tables near us...but she is clearly in no rush. Meanwhile, the other waitress who had the same floor as her had visited her table at least 5 times. We waive to get our bill.  Overall, it took us an hr and a half to get an appetizer and a drink. No refills were asked. Don't you want to ask if my boyfriend wants another beer so you can get more tip?!? Where is the logic in this?! Needless to say, I don't want to visit this TGIF or another location...just really turned off.

Absolutely the worse Fridays horrible service and dead Decor not just the fact that the new bartender is always bared out and hates his life makes my experience even worse every time I give it try I end up walking out and going to Tyson's Fridays ....

Let me preface this by saying I LOVE anything with Jack Daniel's sauce but I hate the Fair Oaks Friday's. I live across the street from this location but would rather drive to the Herndon one than deal with these people. Service in the bar area is consistently abysmal. Today was the final straw. Sat in a booth and watched servers standing and talking to each other in the corner for 10 minutes. We were never greeted or acknowledged. Ended up leaving and going to Applebee's. The food isn't nearly as good but the poor service at Friday's makes Applebee's look like a 5 star restaurant. Ugh.

I get that a lot of people rate their neighborhood/local iteration of a particular franchise as so much better than the other stores of a franchise, probably because they are used to the servers, layout, etc... Rest assured that's not the case. Over the past 8 or 9-odd number of years, I've sporadically visited this T.G.I Friday's location. I never gave it much thought. It's a T.G.I. Fridays, and it's got the T.G.I. menu, the standard T.G.I specials, decor, food, and servers. And really, I never thought I'd be sitting at a computer writing a review for a T.G.I. Fridays, either. But when I went for a quick dinner tonight, it occurred to me: of all these visits to T.G.I. Fridays over the years, I have never left dissatisfied. And, especially for a chain restaurant, that says a lot! In fact, there are many things I like about the chain--the food is consistent, the service is always friendly (kudos to Michelle in the VIP section!), the specials last well past the hours where other places start charging full price, they have many specials on food and drink, and the menu is diverse and ever-changing. A few menu items even stick out in my mind: I really like their green bean fries as an appetizer, and their Jack Daniels sauce is good on just about anything--from burgers to ribs. The burgers are solid, desserts are tasty, and bartenders are always happy to pour you a drink. Oh, and don't forget their home-made potato chips: tasty! So, how is it overall? Let's be realistic: it's a national chain "neighborhood" restaurant. Having said that, I think it personally kicks the behind of Applebees, Chilis, or any other competitor, by offering a big changing menu, perks for "VIP" members, great specials, good food, great service, and a fun, clean atmosphere. I totally have no problem grabbing a meal here, and as I make my rounds through my usual list of places to grab a quick weeknight dinner or drink, T.G.I is always in consideration. Do I feel this way because I live close to this location specifically? Nope, of the few times I've been to the Tysons location, I actually think the food there is slightly better made. But is the Fairfax location "worse" by any means? Not at all. This is a fine restaurant that does all the important stuff right: provide great portions of tasty food in a fun atmosphere at low prices served by friendly servers.

TGI Friday's is nothing exceptional, but the food tends to get significantly more delicious here as the calorie count goes up.  Every salad I've gotten at this location has come out with semi-frozen lettuce and has tasted watery.  Every. Single. One.  But the mozzarella sticks? Fabulous. The service is pretty good, there are tasty things on the menu, and the bar seems to be pretty popular.

So thinking that this TGIF would be better then the one in the hood when it came to service, booooy was I wrong! Now I know though. Next time I'm staying true to mine! It took for ever just to be acknowledged then the food took forever. Granted the waiter was cool but service was wack! It's on you to roll the dice, good luck!

Came here for eat about 45 minutes before a Paint Nite event, came with a friend and another friend was running late.  Ordered our food, my friend came a few minutes later and she ordered hers.  The waitress came back to confirm what I ordered, then a few minutes later both of my friends got their food and they brought me the wrong meal. My friends were almost finished eating and I had less than 10 minutes before the Paint Nite started when my food finally came - the Jack Daniels Chicken Sandwich.  Took a bite, it seemed chewy like gristle, so i looked down at the chicken and it was completely raw. Sent it back and asked for them to just take it off of my bill since I didn't have time to eat now.  Manager offered a new meal but I again stated I didn't have time to eat and so he offered dessert after, which I also declined and said I would take something to use at a later date. So I got a coupon for a free appetizer and of course didn't have to pay for my meal but both of my friends' checks were messed up.  I will not eat here again.

I'm a fan of any place that has a three for whatever deal! The choices they provide for it are decent.  Our service was great for the first time in my history of visiting this chain. If you do come to this exact location, ask for Wais. He was very personable and didn't skimp on the drink refills. Question: Why is it that every TGIF has the most douchey hostesses? Can somebody please answer this for me?

If I order a margarita and it's tastes like tequila and water... Is there really no solution to making it more drinkable? I can't believe the "master of margaritas" recipe is limited to triple sec and margarita mix. Disappointed.

So I walked in to get a midnight snack with a friend.. The brownie obession (one of the few things that I still enjoy on the menu). We walk in to the bar, and sit down waiting for a server to approach. Two servers standing less than two feet from us, continually talk and laugh with each other, all the meanwhile ignoring us. I make eye contact with one of them (at this point my entire body is swiveled towards them... Hoping body language works better..) and again they completely ignore us. Finally, I walk up to them and ask them if they are closed. The guy rudely snaps "No. We close at 1:30" I look at them confused and ask, "OK, should I order at the bar or somewhere else?" The girl FINALLY UNDERSTANDS my not so subtle hint at doing her job and asks for my order.. We get our waters rather quickly, and so we think that perhaps it was just a misunderstanding. WELL... No. We wait about 20 minutes without one person asking us if we've been taken care of or checking on our order.. (I actually tried to walk up to another server but they also walked away)...I mean how long does it take to warm up a brownie and to scoop ice cream?? Finally we just get up and leave the restaurant at 12:50 without our order... And expectedly no one notices again. Needless to say, it was extremely disappointing and absolutely rude. They should not employ incompetent workers if they want to retain customers who actually want to spend money there.

I've been to a few T.G.I Friday's before and the food is pretty much the same at all of them. The food we had was noticeably below that level. It was overcooked, and a bit too hard on the outside (we both got chicken). I got a dish that was served on one of those hot plates, but the smell of burnt food and some weird plasticy smell was just wafting up at me.  The smell was so disgusting I actually had to move my food to another plate. I think I could have cooked better (and i'm not even that good of a cook hah).

Steaks are inedible.  I think the guys in the kitchen know they are serving a substandard product when it comes to steaks.  The bar has a nice vibe, the service is attentive, the french fries are OK, the tomato mozzarella salad is a good "side" choice, but steaks?  Forget it.  Go elsewhere.  Anywhere else.

Won't recommend this location to ANYONE! I was seated at a table of 5 next to a table of 2 fellow African Americans. We were having a wonderful dining experience except for an alcoholic beverage that had to be re-made. Then when it came time for  the bill, we asked for all to be split and it seemed like a simple enough thing. Our waitress however had to attend to others so she gave our checkbooks to her manager, Juliet, who then came back and one person in our party was charged twice for the alcoholic beverage that was taken back and remade because it wasn't made right. After that, she gave us two other checkbooks back, but they were not ours, they belonged to the party next to us and we gave them their checkbooks and they were also aggravated that their credit cards were handed over to strangers. After that, we were waiting to get our checkbooks and waited approximately 20 minutes, and when Juliet came back she did not apologize, she in fact assumed that since we were the same race as the party next to us that we were all together. We took offense to that and she clearly did not see anything wrong with her assumption or with the fact that had missed our movie because we were waiting on her. I would understand if they were busy, but they only had three parties in our section!

This is where I first OD'd on the turtle -- a hot brownie with vanilla ice cream on top.  Back in 2003, the turtle filled a plate big enough to share with 8 people. But I was only there with 1 or 2 others max. Your eyes roll to the back of your head, and slight comatose arrives within a second of your first bite. Two or three bites, and you start to feel sick. Since then, I think Friday's reduced the portion size.  Pity, it no longer seems worth the money for this cheapskate. Friday's culture has been spoofed on Office Space -- as played out by Jennifer Aniston and her flair.  My friend S does a good impression of whenever someone has a birthday there. The waiters march, clap and yell a rhyme in sync, military style.  The bar area is usually full of people, so come here to feel the Fair Lakes vibe.

I'm really not a huge fan of places like TGI Friday's or Ruby Tuesday, but I came here with a friend the other day and the food was okay. I had the BBQ chicken wrap with a side salad. Kind of redundant, but whatever. The wrap fell apart as I tried to eat it, but that happens a lot. The service was good-- our waiter was nice, although he came by a little too many times with "is everything okay, ladies?" I feel like there's a limit for how many times you can come over and ask that while people are trying to have a conversation. They had the game on which is cool-- I would have loved to have stayed to see the loud people in the bar's reaction to losing to Dallas...heh heh heh.

Your typical chain Friday's. For my entree I got an appetizer sampler. Everything tasted like it had been reheated, but I sort of expect that at these places. My date got the hot wings and liked them. Decent selection of mixed drinks. Service was pretty good.

This is honestly one of the better Friday's that I have been to. I am always greeted at the door and get a table quickly. There is always a crowd at the bar- engaged in conversation or a game, depending on the night. The service here really hasn't been hit or miss- I've always gotten pleasant service- whether it's a warm greeting, prompt refills, or that waitress that just makes you want to leave her a bigger tip because she's trying so hard to make you believe she likes her job. The food is the same as any other Friday's (of course) but it's the service that makes the difference here. Plus, the bathrooms are clean.

Went there yesterday, ordered Buffalo Wings, they look like they had been sitting outside in this great 80 degree day, could not eat them. I came here because i wanted some ribs. They were extreamly dry and tough. And i'm not sure what that thing was they call cole slaw. I ate here last year and it was just the same, but i thught i would give it a second try. I did but not a third.
Definitely a fun and lively place to go.  Far more lively than other TGIF's in the area.  The locale is young due to GMU being so nearby.  The staff are fun and friendly.

Our server, Mike, was awesome and attentive. Unfortunately, the food at this restaurant was HORRIBLE, both proportion and the the food itself. The food was absolutely sloppy and NOTHING near what the pictures displayed in the menu. Mike got the manager for us but he just had an excuse for every item. He offered more fries to balance the poor portion size. They did not even give us a discount! I will not be coming back here. 5 unhappy customers who will take there business elsewhere. Thanks to Mike for his service though.

We arrived on a Saturday and the place was pretty empty but were told there was a ten minute wait because they were short staffed. No problem, we got a table in the bar area. The bartender/waiter was good and very attentive. I ordered the buffalo wings (almost $10 for ten) and a stacked hamburger for over $11. The wings were mediocre, some incredibly small, and if you think about almost $1 per wing, way over-priced. The stacked burger looked good in the menu picture but when it came it looked like something you'd get from a fast food joint, only with a slightly better bun. Again, way over priced. The sweet potato fries were unremarkable. Bottom line - good service, good atmosphere, mediocre and over priced food.

We came here for my lunch hour from work which is really close to this location. Since I was working on a holiday it wasn't very busy for being noon on a Monday. We were seated immediately and were able to place our lunch order pretty quickly. Service was adequate but it took a little too long to get our order for the place being nearly empty and the very simple lunch order. I ended up getting my entree to go in the end as I had to get back to work. Food was fine and what you would expect from a middle level chain.  It was nicely decorated inside and everything was clean. I'll probably go back at some point since its close.

im grading this review based on my last experience in this TGI location. i've been here a lot of times with friends and coworkers and mainly gone to the bar area. i have to tell you that most of the servers are good except for this ONE lady that thinks that because she thinks shes pretty she can get a good tip (well she sucks at customer service, anyway). the other bartenders are good and a few of them are great! this week i went for the dining area with a party of 10 people. Dave was our server and even though my friends are a pain in the butt sometimes, Dave was always nice and efficient. the food came out hot and it tasted very yummy. everything came out perfect as my friends and i celebrated our pre-thanksgiving get together (i know, not the best place to have a thanksgiving dinner, but we are not so picky). TIPS: if u want the specials sit at the bar. they are all good. try the mango lemonade shaker for a refreshing fruity drink. the wings are sometimes good and sometimes not so good. Try to not sit at that one lady's section (if you think you know who she is, you can kind of spot her as soon as you walk in lol). their spinach flatbread is really good. if it wasn't for dave i would've given it a 3 star

We came here late at night and the service sucked. The waiter wasn't attentive and the food took forever to get. The desserts were extremely sweet, to the point where you couldn't enjoy it. Overall, this place was "meh"

I'm echoing an earlier reviewer's compliment of Wais.  He was excellent.  I was a touch worried about hitting this Fridays as the reviews via Google were pretty bad.  I think they may have had a thorough house cleaning because the host who seated us was friendly, both our waiter and the 2nd gentleman who was in the area were attentive, the food was above par (for Fridays) and even a manager type swung by to see how we were doing. Ale-braised ribs & caeser salad and a mudslide martini 3-for w/ Cajun shrimp & pasta, a wedge and a german chocolate cake sipper + an Oreo Madness Oh and the Friday's Stripes chips & salsa They were out of cheesecake though :-(
Over priced food and watered down drinks.  But it's TGI Friday's.  What were you expecting?

They've cleaned this place up and renovated.  Probably more of a 3.5 star joint, but I can't give it 4.   The food is pretty consistent and good to eat with caveats.  I get the cajun chicken pasta, but only having them go light on the sauce.  Regularly the sauce is waaay to overwhelming and gross.  Soft pretzels are good.

My husband and I rarely get out since we have a baby so we were excited to embrace the rare opportunity to go out and enjoy an evening alone. We decided to go to TGI Fridays and catch the Dallas/Redskins game on a Sunday and grab a couple drinks. Everyone was accommodating and food was great.

Food is phenomenal, desserts are top notch.  Get the rewards card and you'll receive coupons for half priced entrees or free appetizers. Extremely nice wait staff, but terrible hostess.  Go at least once a week and never greeted with a smile.  But their probably just paid hourly and just want to get the heck out of there.

We love TGIF across America but this one was awful.  Waitress got in fight with another waiter to take our table then didn't bring the food out.  Waited an hour and called for manager to help us.  They compt the meal but it wasn't edible.  Never again to this one.
Love the late hours...staff is friendly and it feels like "cheers" in there...sometimes people know my name :-)

The food is great. I ordered a salad and some tacos and they were delicious. And not to mention the salad is huge compared to most other places. It will definitely fill you up. Furthermore the server was awesome. She refilled our drinks plenty of times and alway stopped by to ask if we needed anything. I came here on my birthday and they even treated me with dessert. t's the perfect place to dine with family or friends.

I like the dessert there but the food just okay not great the restaurant look  very dark the food price is reasonable but the drink a liltte bit pricy for the cocktail so total everything is OK for me , will return some time if i want a good dessert .

I miss the old bartending crew from my immediate post college years...now they have a new crew that is so so, but they do not really detract from the Fridays experience.   Food is always iffy at any Fridays, and this one is no exception.  Do not come to this place expecting to cut calories.  Some advice, stick to the more popular apps and anything that has Jack Daniels in the name.   Great place to drink with friends, def gets crowded though.  Desserts are awesome as well. See you next friday, fridays.

Happy hour on Saturday night?  Are you kidding me?  This is the promised land. I was there last night and my waitress asked if we wanted to take advantage of the happy hour specials.  Appetizers were half off, drinks were dirt cheap, and they had some 5 dollar sandwich/salad special....  Rolling Subway style ! I went with the Chipotle Steak Sandwich and I have to say that it was good. This friday's has always been one of my favorites and service has always been friendly.  There is plenty of parking and it's in the middle of everything in Fairfax.  The bar area is the best place to hang out with friends.......  gotta love my Friday's.
Consistent friendly service and food is pretty darn good. Nothing to rave about, but nothing to shy from either.
My husband and I have gone to Friday's and we really like the food and food options. We avoid going there as regulars due to slow service and too much shtick. We just want good food, fast.

My issue with TGI Friday's in general is that almost any of them I've been to, I can never get good service.  This one broke the streak, as my friend and I were helped fairly quickly and the girls in the bar area took pretty good care of us for the evening we were there.

I have been visiting this place sporadically for years.....at some point I thought the service at this place sucked. However, the last few visits have been pleasant. We went recently and I have to say that I am into there ribs and Jack Daniels stuff. I don't drink and drive, so I couldn't tell ya about the bar.
